newsitem.title: USA: Central Newspapers advertising revenues up.
newsitem.headline: Central Newspapers advertising revenues up.

text.p: Central Newspapers Inc said Tuesday its third-quarter advertising revenues rose 10.3 percent and its circulation revenues gained 6.2 percent over the same year-ago period.
Total revenues advanced to $149.0 million from $135.5 million in the quarter.

"Advertising revenues strengthened in the third quarter, while the newsprint story continues to be a favorable one due to declining prices," said president Louis Weil III in a statement. "With these two factors in place, business conditions are good going into the fourth quarter."

Central Newspapers, the 11th largest publicly traded U.S. newspaper company in terms of circulation, reported earnings for the quarter rose to $0.57 per share from $0.42. The year-ago results included a charge of $0.02 a share.
